means: 使成杂色(variegate的过去式和过去分词)

sentence.Network_en: The leaves are a variegated red.
sentence.Network_cn: 这些树叶呈斑驳的红色。

sentence.Network_en: This specimen is richly variegated in colour.
sentence.Network_cn: 这件标本上有很多颜色.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: from Latin variegat- 'made varied' (from the verb variegare, from varius 'diverse') + -ed

entry.def: A variegated leaf or plant has different colours on it.

example.ex: The leaves are a variegated red.
example.tran: 这些树叶呈斑驳的红色。

entry.tran: 多种多样的;形形色色的
entry.def: Something that is variegated consists of many different parts or types.

sentences.en: This plant has beautifully variegated leaves.
sentences.cn: 这种植物的叶子色彩斑驳，非常美丽。

sentences.en: This specimen is richly variegated in colour.
sentences.cn: 这件标本上有很多颜色。

sentences.en: We’re going to grow a variegated ivy up the back of the house.
sentences.cn: 我们打算在房子后面种一棵杂色常春藤。
